speaker: BEARDED MAN
line: Get going.

speaker: BOB
line: Please...

speaker: BEARDED MAN
line: Do your damn job.

speaker: JANET
line: You can't think Milli Vanilli is cool. I would disown you. You are unbelievable. Okay, I may puke, but I have to ask. Which one do you intend to marry? Rob or Fab?

speaker: MOTHER
line: Janet, get that.

speaker: JANET
line: Hang on. I'm like the servant around here.

speaker: JANET
line: Yeah?

speaker: BOB
line: Triboro Cable.

speaker: JANET
line: What do you want?

speaker: BOB
line: Your cable's out.

speaker: JANET
line: Is it? I don't think so.

speaker: BOB
line: Okay, I'm sorry.

speaker: JANET
line: Wait a sec. Maybe my dad called you. You'd better... come in.

speaker: JANET
line: The TV's in here. Dad? Cable guy's here.

speaker: DAD
line: Can I help you?

speaker: BOB
line: There's a problem with your cable?

speaker: DAD
line: I was just watchin' the game upstairs. I think you got the wrong house, buddy.

speaker: DAD
line: Is... that your work order? Who called it in?

speaker: DUKE
line: Police! Don't move! Oh God, almighty. Face the wall. Face the wall! Johnny, check the other rooms!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: They're all dead!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Got you. Got you, you bastard.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: D-O-G-G-E-T-T. Two "G's" and two "T's". I was the arresting officer. You're makin' a huge mistake. I don't care what it shows!! I appreciate that. But I don't care what it shows. It's wrong! I was there! We got the right guy!

speaker: REYES
line: An X-File?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm tellin' you, you let this guy go, more people are gonna die.

speaker: REYES
line: Was that the D.A. on the case?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Assistant D.A. Some jack-off who was probably in ninth grade when this happened.

speaker: REYES
line: What is it exactly you want 'em to do?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Keep the bastard locked up where he belongs! Did you read that? My partner and I busted this guy, Fassl, when I was a beat cop thirteen years ago. He killed seven people. Now they want to let him go so he can kill again.

speaker: REYES
line: It says here the DNA evidence proves he's innocent.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It's wrong. It's some lab mistake. Simple as that. My partner, Duke and I, we catch this nine-one-one. Neighbours hearing screaming coming from this house on Flatbush Avenue. We get there. Teenage girl, mother, father, all dead. There's blood... I can still remember the sound of the blood squishing under my shoes. This guy, Fassl's just standing there.

speaker: REYES
line: So you... didn't actually catch him in the act?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Ten seconds earlier through the door and we would have.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Tell me you've got good news.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have combed through every detail of this M.E.'s report. I have read and re-read it. And I am sorry, Agent Doggett, but the DNA fingerprinting does indeed exonerate this man.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're tellin' me there's no way? There's not even a million-to-one chance that these DNA tests are wrong?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Actually, a hundred million.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I need the reports run again. I need you to do it yourself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett, you don't... It'd take at least 48 hours.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That's too long.

speaker: REYES
line: Where are you going?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: New York. I can't just sit here and wait for this guy to kill again.

speaker: REYES
line: John...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Look, I get it. Enough people tell you you're drunk, it's time to lie down. But I know what I know. I could really use your help.

speaker: GUARD
line: It's time to go.

speaker: GUARD
line: Congratulations, Bob. Best of luck to you..

speaker: REPORTER #1
line: How does it feel to be a free man?

speaker: REPORTER #2
line: What are doing in New York? Are you gonna sue the police?

speaker: REPORTER #1
line: What do you think you'll do next?

speaker: JANA
line: I think it goes without saying that my client is happy once more to be a free man. I myself, am overjoyed. I think today is a day to celebrate. But tomorrow, we will be looking very closely at the reasons why Bob was falsely accused and incarcerated. Thirteen years of his life were stolen from him. We'll be looking. at the Brooklyn D.A.'s office, and the New York City Police Department.

speaker: JANA
line: Bob? Let's get you out of here. Thank you.

speaker: REPORTERS
line: How do you feel?

speaker: JANA
line: Thank you.

speaker: REPORTERS
line: Did you ever feel like givin' up, Bob? Bob?

speaker: JANA
line: Thank you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Wait a minute. On top of springin' loose a murderer, you're tellin' me the city of New York is gonna pay him off?

speaker: KAILER
line: Hell yes. And count ourselves lucky. We didn't spring a murderer. We sprang an innocent man. Or maybe you didn't glean that from our previous conversation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr. Kailer, on the off chance that that's not true, what would be the harm in letting us look through your documents pertaining to this case? I mean, who knows. Maybe we can save the city some settlement money.

speaker: KAILER
line: Or maybe it gets me in an even bigger jackpot when Jana Fain starts crying "police vendetta", yelling at the papers about the disgruntled former cop who's out to get her client?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Somebody committed these murders, right? And now that you've sprung Mr. Bob Fassl, the victims' families are gonna start askin' who. How you gonna answer 'em?

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's a lot of material here. Where should we start?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Right there. The original arrest report.

speaker: SCULLY
line: "Arresting Officer John Doggett." Must have been a career maker.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, it didn't hurt when I put in for detective. The murders had been front page news for weeks. The sense of relief everybody felt when we caught Fassl, it was...

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know, John? Whatever we find here, sometimes... sometimes even good cops make mistakes.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah. And I've made more than I can count. But this wasn't one of 'em. Whatever you think, I'm not here tryin' to cover my ass.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's not what I think. It's not. I just... I just worry that maybe this is about you feeling guilty.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I feel guilty? Like what, subconsciously? Like I was told I sent an innocent man to prison, only I refuse to accept it? A cop I know, a man I respect deeply, he told me one time... "You don't clock out at the end of your shift unless you know you did everything you could." That's what this is about. Me not clockin' out.

speaker: JANA
line: Bob, I just want you to make yourself at home while you're here. Just relax. Mrs. Dowdy, this is Bob Fassl. He'll be staying with us for a while.

speaker: MRS. DOWDY
line: Oh, I have your room all made up. I hope you'll be quite comfortable.

speaker: JANA
line: Uh, thank you very much, Mrs. Dowdy.

speaker: BOB
line: You're rich.

speaker: JANA
line: Well, my parents were. I inherited this when they died. I've been very fortunate, so I try and use my family's resources to help where I can.

speaker: BOB
line: You do good things. You're a good person.

speaker: JANA
line: I guess it takes one to know one. I know some business people who are sympathetic to your situation, and when you're ready, we'll set up some job interviews.

speaker: JANA
line: I can only imagine what you must be feeling right now. I'm so sorry for everything you've been through. And I'm so happy for you now.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Hey, buddy! You steal that car?

speaker: DUKE
line: If it ain't the FBI!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Duke Tomasick. Lookin' good.

speaker: DUKE
line: Well, hell yeah. I was always the pretty one.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Not that I'd steal you away from even one minute of retirement, but I gotta get another viewpoint on this case from someone who was there that night. Duke, I'm rackin' my brain on this thing, and I'm comin' at it from every possible angle. Was there somethin' we missed?

speaker: DUKE
line: Well yeah, we arrested the wrong man. Ah, I'm sorry, John. I've been torn up about this since I read it in the paper. But unless there's somethin' that you know that I don't? Then it looks like, uh, we're just gonna have to face facts.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Duke, you were there that night. Fassl was the only one in the house. He killed those people.

speaker: DUKE
line: John, wise up, will ya? Drop this thing.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What did you always tell me about bein' a good cop? You said never to clock out.

speaker: DUKE
line: I got another lesson for ya. Keep after this thing, it's gonna bite you in your ass.

speaker: JANA
line: I'm sorry. I just wanted to see how you were settling in, and... I should have knocked. I read in your file that you had once attended the seminary, that you studied to be a priest? I think it's wonderful that all you've been through hasn't diminished your faith.

speaker: BOB
line: I pray all the time. I pray even when it looks like I'm not praying.

speaker: JANA
line: I know someone's listening, Bob. Goodnight.

speaker: BOB
line: No. Don't. Please don't hurt her. Please!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Were you here all night?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: There's gotta be somethin' here the prosecution overlooked, I overlooked. Somethin' I can hang this guy with, DNA or no.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Speaking of DNA.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Ah, come on.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The re-tests of the typing confirm the original results, that the hair samples do, indeed, belong to someone other than Robert Fassl.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So what do we do, we just go home? This is wrong. This is...

speaker: SCULLY
line: John, there is something else. Something that explains why 13 years ago, the science of the day identified the hair as Fassl's. I spoke to the forensic examiner who ran the tests, and he found a match in 12 of the 13 key genes.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What does that mean?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It means that the mitochondrial DNA in the hair sample is genetically similar to Fassl's. In fact, it is remarkably similar. It is so similar that it must be from a blood relative.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Wait a minute. Fassl's an only child. His parents died when he was 13. He's got nobody.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You know. And you know that what you're sayin's impossible.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And yet, somehow it's true.

speaker: JANA
line: Would you get dressed and come on downstairs, please?

speaker: JANA
line: Bob? This morning I noticed something that I have to talk to you about. The dresser drawers in my bedroom had been opened and somebody had been through my things.

speaker: BOB
line: You weren't home last night?

speaker: JANA
line: I think you know that I wasn't. As it happens, I was called down to County Lockup on behalf of another client. If you're going to stay here, then you have to respect me, my privacy, my possessions. You're a free man now. And with freedom comes responsibility. I am late for a deposition. Help yourself to breakfast. Mrs. Dowdy seems to be running late this morning.

speaker: HUTCHINSON
line: Agent Reyes. I'm Brian Hutchinson, Superintendent.

speaker: REYES
line: I appreciate you seeing me on such short notice.

speaker: HUTCHINSON
line: Anything I can do to help.

speaker: REYES
line: Great. I'm reviewing evidence pertinent to the Fassl case.

speaker: HUTCHINSON
line: Whatever I can do to ensure he gets locked back up again. By all means, tell me what you need.

speaker: REYES
line: Thank you. That's an extremely helpful attitude. What's your reason for it?

speaker: HUTCHINSON
line: I just don't think the system should've let him go.

speaker: REYES
line: Why, exactly? The court says he's innocent.

speaker: HUTCHINSON
line: Maybe. But there's another murder they don't know about.

speaker: HUTCHINSON
line: Bob Fassl's cellmate... was a biker named Spud Jennings, a real bad ass. Or at least he thought he was.

speaker: REYES
line: Jennings was murdered?

speaker: HUTCHINSON
line: Oh yeah. We found him in a hallway that Bob Fassl had been mopping. He was lying ten feet from Bob Fassl's mop bucket. Fassl nowhere to be found.

speaker: REYES
line: And Fassl killed him?

speaker: HUTCHINSON
line: The murderer was caught on a security camera once he turned the corner. This is a videograph. A pretty clear one. You can see the blood on his hand.

speaker: REYES
line: One problem. This isn't Fassl.

speaker: HUTCHINSON
line: This isn't anybody. This man doesn't fit the description of any inmate currently incarcerated here. We haven't been able to find him since. Don't ask me to explain it. We couldn't charge Fassl with it, either. But I sure as hell know he had something to do with it.

speaker: KAILER
line: Agent Doggett? A word, please?

speaker: KAILER
line: Don't you have something to tell me, Agent Doggett?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What do you mean?

speaker: KAILER
line: The DNA retests. I understand you received the results this morning. Mr. Fassl has been exonerated. Again.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The results aren't that simple. The DNA is similar to Fassl's to a degree we haven't quite made sense of yet.

speaker: KAILER
line: Look, I just spoke to the D.A. He's authorized a settlement offer, which I intend to deliver to Mr. Fassl's counsel, post haste. I'll send the bailiffs down to retrieve the case files. Have a nice flight back to D.C.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We need more time to get to the truth!

speaker: KAILER
line: This isn't about the truth. This is about getting a conviction, Agent Doggett. And if we can't get a conviction, then the truth doesn't matter.

speaker: REYES
line: John. I may have a break in this case. A suspect.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: A suspect? Not Fassl?

speaker: REYES
line: You really need to see this.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So who is he?

speaker: REYES
line: I'm wondering more along the line of what is he. I ran him through the Known Offender Database, Facial Recognition, came up with nothing. It's like he has no identity. Yet somehow, this person materialized inside a maximum security prison, killed an inmate, and then vanished into thin air.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Materialized how, like Casper the Friendly Ghost? When Duke and I entered that house back in '89, we didn't find ZZ Top here. We found Bob Fassl. End of story.

speaker: REYES
line: Yeah, but what if the two were somehow connected?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Monica, for God sakes, this is not an X-File. Don't try to turn it into one.

speaker: REYES
line: In prison, this being, this person, whatever you want to call him, he acted as if he were protecting Bob Fassl.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Protecting? How, by getting him locked up in prison in the first place?

speaker: REYES
line: So either he's doing Fassl's bidding, or Fassl's doing his. However you slice it, I'm thinking this bearded man was the one who committed the other seven murders. I think we can prove it. DNA evidence in the Sing Sing murder was gathered and filed by the prison authorities. All we have to do is compare it to the DNA from the 1989 murders.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. Unfortunately, that's not gonna work. The 1989 evidence has to be thrown out.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What are you talkin' about?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The hair samples logged to your crime scene, Agent Doggett, were not there on the day the crimes were committed.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Are you accusing me? Are you accusing me of planting evidence?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I am simply stating the facts, okay? The DNA evidence that was used to convict Bob Fassl... was planted.

speaker: KAILER
line: Fassl? I'm Damon Kailer.

speaker: KAYLOR
line: I need to speak with your attorney. Is she here?

speaker: BOB
line: You were at my hearing.

speaker: KAILER
line: I'm the Assistant District Attorney. Is... Jana home?

speaker: BOB
line: She's not here.

speaker: KAILER
line: Mr. Fassl, I came to make a settlement offer on your case. There's no reason to be upset. This is good news for you. Tell her to call me. We'll work it out.

speaker: BOB
line: I want to go back.

speaker: KAILER
line: I'm sorry?

speaker: BOB
line: Please send me back to prison.

speaker: KAILER
line: Oh listen, Mr. Fassl, I shouldn't even be discussing this with you without your attorney present.

speaker: BOB
line: But it's my fault.

speaker: KAILER
line: I-I... I can't be hearing this.

speaker: BOB
line: It's the truth.

speaker: KAILER
line: That's not my concern.

speaker: DUKE
line: I'm sorry, John.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You framed Fassl.

speaker: DUKE
line: You saw how it was goin' down. we arrested him at the scene. But he... he left no prints, no hair, no fibre. Nothin' to actually tie him to the murders.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: How did you do it?

speaker: DUKE
line: I took, uh, part of a hair sample that was found at a... at a previous murder, and put it in with the evidence from our crime scene.

speaker: DUKE
line: Johnny, it was the one and only time I ever did anything like that. I was scared Fassl would walk, and... and I couldn't let that happen. Not when I knew that... that he was guilty. Oh, God almighty.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You know this is gonna come out. No one's gonna hear it from me, but... but I can't put Agent Scully on the spot. I can't ask her to lie.

speaker: DUKE
line: I don't want you to.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Duke, you son of a bitch! This is a felony!! I don't know how I can forgive you for this! You break my heart.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me. Agent Doggett? A.D.A. Kailer. I assume you haven't seen him?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No. Why?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Apparently nobody has.

speaker: REYES
line: Mr. Fassl, when was the last time you saw Damon Kailer?

speaker: JANA
line: Two days ago at his release hearing. My client had nothing to do with Mr. Kailer's disappearance.

speaker: REYES
line: No direct involvement?

speaker: JANA
line: None.

speaker: REYES
line: I think we can accept that. We're also prepared to accept that Mr. Fassl had no direct involvement in the seven murders he was previously convicted of.

speaker: JANA
line: How magnanimous of you. It's too bad you're thirteen years too late. Is that it?

speaker: REYES
line: No. Actually, we believe this person committed the murders.

speaker: REYES
line: What do you think? Do you recognize this man?

speaker: JANA
line: We're here as a courtesy. Which is something the police and the prosecution never showed Bob once.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you a Catholic, Bob? So am I. I remember times in my life when my Rosary was a great comfort to me. Comfort in times of tribulation. And watching you now, I get the feeling... that this is a tribulation for you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This man. Is it that he won't leave you alone, Bob? Is it that you just want him to go away? Tell us about him. Tell us so we can help make him go away.

speaker: JANA
line: No more mind games. We're done.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What the hell was that?

speaker: REYES
line: I don't know about you, but that was me changing my theory.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What, no more ghosts?

speaker: REYES
line: Nope. Just Fassl. What if a man of profound faith, a devout Catholic, was incapable of contrition?

speaker: SCULLY
line: As in he couldn't admit his own sins?

speaker: REYES
line: Or even that he had a sinful side to him, as we all do. What if he were so frightened by it that he couldn't even admit it to himself. Might not someone like that manifest a second personality?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: But it wouldn't explain the DNA evidence.

speaker: REYES
line: It would if he physically became that other personality.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So what, we've moved on from Casper the Friendly Ghost to Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde?

speaker: REYES
line: There is a precedent in the Catholic Canon itself. Transubstantiation. The manipulation of matter and energy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You mean water into wine?

speaker: REYES
line: Or the Communion wafer into the body of Christ.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well Monica, I've slept through my share of Sunday Schools, but I never heard the story about the guy becoming another guy.

speaker: REYES
line: It's the one explanation that makes sense. It explains what happened thirteen years ago, and it explains what's happening now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So what you're saying is because this man won't face himself, won't face his own sins, that he is forced to become someone else? A killer.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So how does someone go about catching a killer who hides inside an innocent man?

speaker: BEARDED MAN
line: Do it!

speaker: BOB
line: I don't want to hurt her!

speaker: JANA
line: Bob, are you okay?

speaker: BEARDED MAN
line: Kill her.

speaker: JANA
line: Oh, my god. What happened?

speaker: BOB
line: I, uh... I-I fell.

speaker: JANA
line: I'll fix you up. You'll be okay.

speaker: REYES
line: I'll take the next couple of hours. You should get some shut-eye. John, give yourself a break. You haven't slept in 48 hours.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'll sleep once we make sure this guy, Fassl, never kills again. Fassl or this... Charlie Manson sidekick.

speaker: REYES
line: They're one and the same person.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Monica, I don't want to hear...

speaker: REYES
line: But I just need to hear another theory that makes sense.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That theory doesn't make any sense. How the hell to you does that make sense? Meat and potatoes police work is what busted this guy thirteen years ago. And it's what's gonna bust him again. And that's enough. And the day that's not enough? Then I don't know what to tell ya. 'Cause I got nothin' else.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Check it out, the front door.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Jana Fain! Check on her!

speaker: JANA
line: Oh my god, he was here! He was here, the man in your photo!

speaker: REYES
line: The Bearded Man. Where's Bob Fassl?

speaker: JANA
line: Oh, he-he was right there, and then he wasn't. I don't... I don't know where.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Reyes!!

speaker: REYES
line: Call the police!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Reyes!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Cable access. Fassl worked for Triboro Cable.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The trail ends here.

speaker: REYES
line: Blood. He could've gone either way.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You okay?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Come on.

speaker: REYES
line: I'll take this way. REYES John! DOGGETTMonica!

speaker: REYES
line: Let him go, you hear me? Let him go!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Don't waste your breath. Just shoot the bastard!

speaker: REYES
line: Bob Fassl, I'm talking to you. I know you're in there, Bob. There's some small part of you in there that couldn't kill Jana Fain when you had the chance.

speaker: BEARDED MAN
line: I'll kill him!!

speaker: REYES
line: I believe you, Bob. Because you're a murderer.

speaker: BEARDED MAN
line: Shut up!! I'm not him.

speaker: REYES
line: You're not just a murderer, you're a sinner!

speaker: BEARDED MAN
line: Shut up!! Shut up!! Shut up!!

speaker: JANA
line: My housekeeper, Mrs. Dowdy, can I see her?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's better that you don't.

speaker: JANA
line: And the District Attorney?

speaker: SCULLY
line: There are a lot of bodies in there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There are many more victims than anyone ever knew.

speaker: JANA
line: I saw a Bearded Man. I know what I saw.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ms. Fain, I think we'd better get you home.

speaker: REYES
line: John...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I've been 48 hours without sleep. I found out my ex-partner's a liar, a felon. Don't ask me to explain how this could be.

speaker: REYES
line: So what happened tonight, that was just you seeing things?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I can't accept this. If you can, God love ya, but, it's not the way my mind works.

speaker: REYES
line: You closed this case. This time around, that was enough.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What happens next time?
